alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 10:07AM EST until further notice by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Jefferson County, Kentucky. * WHEN...Until 115 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1006 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Louisville, Jeffersonville, Jeffersontown, St. Matthews, Shively, Lyndon, Middletown, Douglass Hills, Prospect and Hurstbourne. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
